results.title: Nobody waved good-bye
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of teenage conflict - the predicament of a youth who rebels against his parents’ middle-class goals and conventions. Away from home and high school he finds the world a cold place to go it alone. Ideals are no defence when the need dor money leads to shady practices. This feature film is a study of the sources of delinquency in an affluent society, mirroring many of the problems and frustrations of young people. Cast includes: Julie Biggs, Peter Kastner, Charmion King, Ron Taylor, John Vernon.

results.title: Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Bill Justice, Walt Disney and Disney Educational Productions
results.brief_description: An updated version of the old story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is done in an inventive three-dimensional animation technique that will be special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Noah's ark
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Stephen Jones and Babelsberg International Film Produktion
results.brief_description: Australia provides the backdrop for this loose retelling of the eternal story of biblical hero Noah (Jon Voight), the great flood that destroyed the world, and the ark that was built by Noah and his family and housed two of every animal species. This made for television movie was not well received by critics, despite its international cast of Jon Voight, Mary Steenburgen and F. Murray Abraham.

results.title: 1950's volume one
results.creator_credit: Cyriel van den Hemel and Cable Connections Television Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rock n’ roll: the greatest years”.
More than any other decade, the 1950’s is synonymous with the rock and roll revolution. This tape provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. Songs on the tape include: “Heartbreak hotel”, Elvis Presley: “Problems”, Everly Brothers: “Great balls of fire”, Jerry Lee Lewis: “Lollipop”, Chordettes: “Turn me loose”, Cliff Richard: “Blueberry Hill”, Fats Domino: “Peggy Sue”, Buddy Holly: “Diana”, Paul Anka; “Teenage heaven”, Eddie Cochran: “Shakin’ all over”, Vince Taylor: “Memphis Tennessee”, Chuck Berry: “Blue suede shoes”, Carl Perkins: “Puttin’ on the style”, Lonnie Donegan: “Lucille”, Little Richard: “Please, please, please”, James Brown: “I’m not a juvenile delinquent”, Frankie Lymon: “Yes tonight Josephine”, Johnnie Ray: “Three cool cats”; Cliff Richard, Marty Wilde and Dickie Pride: “Wake up little Suzie”, Everly Brothers: “Only you”, The Platters: “I’m in love again”, Fats Domino: “Don’t be cruel (to a heart that’s true)”, Elvis Presley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cyriel van den Hemel and Cable Connections Television Ltd

More than any other decade, the 1950’s is synonymous with the rock and roll revolution. This second tape of hits from the 1950’s provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. My head”, Ritchie Valens: “Baby I don’t care”, Elvis Presley: “Honey chile”, Fats Domino.

results.title: No. 1 hits of the 60's (1960-1965)
results.creator_credit: Cyriel Van Den Heme and Cable Connections
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rock n’ roll: the greatest years”.
This tape provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. Songs on the tape include: “Stars on 45”, Stars on 45: “Only the lonely”, Roy Orbison: “Walk right back”, Everly Brothers: “The Young ones”, Cliff Richard: “Diamonds”, Jet Harris: “I Like it”, Gerry & the Pacemakers: “Do you love me?”, Brian Poole & Tremeloes: “Needles & pins”, Searchers: “World without love”, Peter & Gordon: “Juliet”, Four Pennies: “House of the rising sun”, Animals: “Have I the right”, Honeycombes: “You really got me”, Kinks: “I’m into something good”, Hermans Hermits: “Oh pretty woman”, Roy Orbison: “Go now”, Moody Blues: “You’ve lost that loving feeling”, Righteous Brothers: “I’m alive”, The Hollies.

results.title: No. 1 hits of the 60's (1965-1969)
results.creator_credit: Cyriel Van Den Heme and Cable Connections
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rock n’ roll: the greatest years”.
This tape provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. Songs on the tape include: “Stars on 45”, Stars on 45: ‘Mr Tambourine man”, The Byrds: “I got you babe”, Sonny & Cher: “These boots are made for walking”, Nancy Sinatra: “The Sun ain’t gonna shine anymore”, Walker Brothers: “All or nothing”, Small Faces: “Good vibrations”, Beach Boys: “Whiter shade of pale”, Procol Harum: “Mighty Quinn”, Manfred Mann: “Cinderella Rockafella”, Esther & Obi Ofarim: “Baby come back”, Equals: “Fire”, Arthur Brown: “Those were the days”, Mary Hopkin: “Albatross”, Fleetwood Mac: “(If paradise is) half as nice”, Amen Corner: “In the year 2525”, Zager & Evans: “Something in the air”, Thunderclap Newman.

results.title: Kangaroo Island
results.creator_credit: Ron Lowe and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Australian wildlife seen by visitors to Kangaroo Island, South Australia, is the subject of this award-winning film. Koalas, kangaroos, emus, pelicans and seals abound on this island sanctuary, completely unafraid of humans. Their daily activities form a fascinating study. Contains no commentary, only sounds of nature and background music composed by Bruce Smeaton. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
